means: 不赞成( disapprove的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Teddy clucked his tongue like a disapproving English matron.
sentence.Network_cn: 特迪咂了咂舌头，活像个不以为然的英国女舍监。

sentence.Network_en: Janet gave him a disapproving look.
sentence.Network_cn: 珍妮特不满地看了他一眼。
他摇晃着手指表示不同意。

entry.tran: 不赞成的;表示反对的;不以为然的
entry.def: A disapproving action or expression shows that you do not approve of something or someone.

example.ex: Janet gave him a disapproving look.
example.tran: 珍妮特不满地看了他一眼。

auth_sentence.content: I widened my eyes and tried to look disapproving.
auth_sentence.res_content: I widened my eyes and tried to look disapproving.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I widened my eyes and tried to look disapproving.

auth_sentence.content: Well, Mrs Disapproving of Tunbridge Wells, I disagree.
auth_sentence.res_content: Well, Mrs Disapproving of Tunbridge Wells, I disagree.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well, Mrs Disapproving of Tunbridge Wells, I disagree.

auth_sentence.content: Then he squinted and gave the map a disapproving glance.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then he squinted and gave the map a disapproving glance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then he squinted and gave the map a disapproving glance.

sentences.en: Her father threw a disapproving glance at her.
sentences.cn: 她父亲不满地瞥了她一眼。

sentences.en: Mother gave me a disapproving look.
sentences.cn: 母亲的眼神告诉我她是不赞成的。
